chapter.title: Thirdparty Software Installation and Build Information

section.para: This chapter may help expedite installation of the required third party software. However, this information is not intended to replace the installation instructions that come with the software, but to supplement them. Please read the install instructions for each software distribution before attempting to use this information.

section.title: Prerequisites
section.para: Use of this document requires experience with the SGI Irix operating system and/or the Linux operating system. Knowledge of file systems, programming in C/C++, building software from tarball distributions and shell scripting will be useful, if not required. The installation or upgrade of core system components (such as the OS and compilers) may be required. As such, a system administrator's assistance may be needed.
This document does not address the installation and upgrade of the OS and build tools as those topics are quite involved.

section.title: Automatic Installation of All Thirdparty Software
section.para: Because of many bugs and "gotchas" you would encounter if you installed the required thirdparty software its installation has been automated via the SCI Institute's thirdparty install script. The automatic install script comes with all the necessary thirdparty software, and does not require additional downloads.
To use the automatic install script do the following:

listitem.para: Download the install script tar ball from here.
Put the tar ball into a directory of your choosing.
Unzip and untar the tar ball:
listitem.literallayout: gunzip Thirdparty_install.x.x.x.tar.gz tar xvf Thirdparty_install.x.x.x.tar cd Thirdparty_install.x.x.x

listitem.para: The install script is designed to help organize multiple installations for different architectures or compilers. Run the install script by typing:
listitem.literallayout: python install base-path architecture compiler bit-size
listitem.para: Like this for: 32 bit binaries, on Linux, with a gcc 3.0.4 compiler, installed to /usr/local/SCIRun_Thirdparty :
Your installation would then be under /usr/local/SCIRun_Thirdparty/Linux/gcc-3.0.4-32bit

The install script requires Python version 1.5.2 or greater.

You may reinstall part or all of the required thirdparty software by repeating the above command. This time since the target directory exists, you will be asked to replace all or part of the installation. Just answer y or n to the script until you have selected the exact reinstallation you wish.
